definition: to freeze (water etc)/(fig.) to freeze (assets, prices etc)
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)

sentences.english: The day a Chinese multi-billionaire takes over Hollywood will be the time hell freezes over.
sentences.chinese: 中國億萬富翁接管好萊塢的那一天地獄都會凍結。

sentences.english: The freezing process may destroy donor cells and decrease the size of the graft.
sentences.chinese: 凍結過程可能會破壞供體細胞，減少移植物的大小。

sentences.english: The occupiers immediately froze wages and made strikes illegal .
sentences.chinese: 佔領軍立即宣佈凍結工資並規定罷工爲非法。

sentences.english: Thus, ice floats on water and a body of water freezes from the top down.
sentences.chinese: 因此，冰浮在水上，水體從上向下凍結。

sentences.english: Their extremely low temperatures can produce cryogenic burns of the skin and freeze underlying tissue.
sentences.chinese: 它們的超低溫會造成皮膚凍傷和皮下組織凍結。

sentences.english: The manager's suggestion to freeze salary raises catcalls among the staff.
sentences.chinese: 經理凍結薪金的建議引起職員的反對聲音。

sentences.english: The United States and the North Korean Government have reached understanding on the disposition of DPRK related funds frozen at Banco Delta Asia.
sentences.chinese: 美朝政府就澳門匯業銀行凍結朝鮮資金問題達成共識。

sentences.english: Would harrow up thy soul, freeze thy young blood.
sentences.chinese: 就會直穿你靈府，凍結你熱血。

sentences.english: I've lost my bankcard. Can you stop an transactions?
sentences.chinese: 我遺失了我的銀行卡，你能幫我凍結賬戶嗎？

sentences.english: There was snow on the ground, and the well was frozen hard at night.
sentences.chinese: 有雪在地面上，井凍結在晚上努力。

sentences.english: Brain Freeze now only affects your frost damage spells with chilling effects.
sentences.chinese: 大腦凍結現在隻影響附帶寒冷效果的冰系傷害法術。

sentences.english: “It’s remarkably stable with freezing and thawing, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: 他說，“相對於凍結和融化來說，它非常穩定。

sentences.english: In deep drift sand strata, Has adopted the freeze method to dig a pit, Has produced the freeze and thaw soil.
sentences.chinese: 深厚流砂層下采用凍結法鑿井，產生了凍融土。

sentences.english: The security of freezing wall is the key problem of freezing shaft sinking in deep alluvium.
sentences.chinese: 凍結壁的安全性是深厚沖積層中凍結鑿井的關鍵問題。

sentences.english: The security of freezing wall is the key problem of freezing shaft sinking in deep alluvium.
sentences.chinese: 凍結壁的安全性是深厚沖積層中凍結鑿井的關鍵問題。

sentences.english: Officers should also act with restraint before freezing the account of an operating firm suspected of committing crimes, according to Zheng.
sentences.chinese: 對涉嫌犯罪企業的正常經營賬戶要慎用凍結措施。

definition: to utilize/to put sth to use

to lock (a door)/to close with a latch/to lock into place/a lock/a latch/to lock a computer file (to prevent it being overwritten)/to lock (denying access to a computer system or device or files, e.g. by password-protection)/to focus attention on/to target
